prompt: Who is considered the founder of formal logic?
hint: This ancient Greek philosopher wrote the first systematic treatise on logic.
explanation: Aristotle (384-322 BCE) is considered the founder of formal logic. His Organon, especially the Prior Analytics, developed syllogistic logic - the dominant logical system for over 2000 years. He systematically studied valid argument forms.
visual_concept: Aristotle created the first 'logical machine' - plug in premises of certain forms, get valid conclusions. This was revolutionary.
